data.title: Great for kids
data.text: I have taken my kids here a few times to make presents for my wife.  It is a fun experience for them and she gets a nice memento.  Staff has always been great.

data.title: So relaxing!
data.text: What a great way to spend an afternoon with a girlfriend.  I always find something fun to paint, and the atmosphere is so relaxing.

data.title: Always a fun and stressfree zone!
data.text: sweet owners and staff - fun place to get creative, paint some masterpieces and enjoy conversation with a group of friends.

data.title: Good for a different type of activity
data.text: We've hosted 2 birthdays at this location, and my wife often takes my children there with no occasion in mind. They love coloring pottery there, and the staff is very mellow and helpful. In addition, the kids get to enjoy it twice, as they go to pick up their pottery a few days later!

data.title: great place
data.text: i have taken my daughter here many times, staff are super helpful and friendly, its great for an art project or to even have a birthday party there

data.title: Really fun - for all ages
data.text: This is a fun place to spend an afternoon, paiting pottery. Fun for all ages. reasonably priced, and friendly staff.

data.title: Stay as long as you like
data.text: Great customer service. You will purchase the piece of pottery you want to paint. The cost of the pottery covers the time you take to paint and as many paint colors and materials as you need. They don't rush you and will help with troubleshooting. Music plays in the background and you can bring your own wine.

data.title: Cool place to take a group of 6-10 year old girls for a Birthday party - they'll have a ball and stay all day.
data.text: They get so busy and giggles galore; also very creative and will always be talking about THAT BIRTHDAY PARTY - WOW!

data.title: Pretend to be artistic for an afternoon!
data.text:
Some website informed me that pottery was a traditional 8th anniversary gift, so I figured the wife and I could hang out for a bit at All Fired Up and paint some pottery.

We had an appointment, but it probably wasn't needed for the time we picked, since we were the only ones in the shop.  We spent about 10 minutes looking back and forth between blank ceramic pieces and finished ones that people with talent completed.

Fortunately, All Fired Up also does glass artwork, where you place glass pieces onto a pattern, which they place in a kiln to create bowls, plates, etc.  We decided to forgo  the idea of painting anything and stuck with the glass projects, which we could at least pretend were supposed to be abstract.

Overall it was a good time.  I've seen a lot of reviews talking about kids groups and ladies nights, but it isn't a bad suggestion for a date night.  I'd recommend coupling it with dinner around the corner in downtown Alpharetta.

data.title: Huge selection of Paint your own Pottery. Fun area to paint in- everything provided
data.text: Brought my mom and daughter for an after school day to paint our own pottery. They have a huge selection of mugs,plates, trivets, and large assortment of fun shaped pottery of all sizes and prices. Many choices of paint colors. We had a blast painting, mixing, and creating our " masterpieces". Facility is fun, well stocked, and easy to use with a lot of tables for large groups. We picked our finished pots up in just 3 days. Would come again.

data.title: Fun place for a girl's night out!
data.text: This is a fun place for a girl's night out, or a child's birthday party.  They are kind of pricey, so be sure you give the kiddos a budget or they can easily spend $50.00 plus!  The things that we made from here were really cute!  It was fun and relaxing.

data.title: Lots of projects to pick from
data.text: Went here with my brother and his kids while they were in town visiting. Had a really good time. Picked up their projects for them and they got them from my on their next visit.

data.title: Fun Place to Relax
data.text: All Fired Up is one of my favorite local pottery places.  They have a "better than most" selection of pottery pieces to select from, cool custom paints (separate cost), friendly staff and a nice ambiance.  My only complaint would be the volume of the music when you go in the evening...it's WAY too loud sometimes (I think it depends on who is working)!

data.title: Great place for girls night out!
data.text: Great place to go with a group of girl friends!  You can bring your own food and beverages. Each person can paint an item from any price point, from $7 up!  We were not rushed and we had a great time!  I would recommend reservations if you have a group!

data.title: Celebrated friend's 60th birthday here!
data.text: All Fired Up welcomes groups or individual drop-ins to make/decorate pottery or glass items.  Select the pottery piece you wish to decorate, the paints & stencils.  The store will fire them for you, and you return a few days later to pick them up.  Store owners are available to answer questions and make suggestions on how to decorate your piece if you're new to pottery.  No experience required.  I saw parents drop by with their children and young couples come by and work together on creating a pottery piece.  Fun way to spend a couple of hours.

data.title: Fun Place for a Birthday Party
data.text: My daughter went to a kids birthday party here and she had fun.  The staff was nice and seemed suited to working with kids.

data.title: Relaxing
data.text: My son and I enjoyed painting pottery here. They had many different types of pottery to choose from, and plenty of room to paint.  The staff was friendly and helpful too!

data.title: Love to relax with crafty art
data.text:
Great place to paint ceramics and get away from your family just some "me" time.  However, they do host birthday parties and you do need to put up with the little girls at the other side of the room sometimes.  I don't mind, but a warning for those who wish ultimate quiet.  
They do glass firings and ceramic glazes.  So you are not limited to one medium.  Pick from already fired ceramics and then paint you piece with glazes from their stock.  OR, try their glass works.  Fuse glass together in artwork and molded shapes with colored glass to create your own unique piece.  Note:  glass work can only be done by adults.

data.title: Summer fun
data.text: I had a broken bone over summer close to Father's Day so me and a friend went and made things for our dads we were 14 spent 2 hours there best place to go very helpful staff

data.title: Good for children and adults
data.text: My daughter and I have been going there since she was little and a friend and I went there yesterday.  I'm not artistic or crafty at all but I can paint ceramics.  We want to take a glass making class.  The store has items in a wide variety of prices.
